data.name: richTextBox1.Text
data.value:
COVID-19 The coronavirus, or COVID-19, is a new strain of coronavirus that has caused a global pandemic. It can cause mild symptoms of the common cold. But people with risk factors, such as old age, diabetes mellitus, heart disease, lung disease, severe immunosuppression,
they are more prone to show severe symptoms of the disease.
Symptoms of COVID-19 are: FEVER/CHILLS
COUGH (usually dry)
DYSPHONOA
GENERAL PAYMENT
MYALGAS
HEADACHE
PHARYNGAL
Upper respiratory tract infection symptoms such as nasal discharge, angina and postnasal drip are less common than the other conditions.
The duration of symptoms ranges from 1-14 days.
SIMPLE COOLING The common cold usually has milder symptoms compared to the flu and COVID-19. The duration of the common cold lasts from 7-10 days and is mainly limited to the upper respiratory system. The symptoms of the common cold are:
SNEEZE
CUTTING AND COLLAPSING
REVERSE CRASH
IRRITATED PHARYNX
COUGH
IRRITATED EYES
HEADACHE (LESS RARE)
SEASONAL FLU Seasonal flu occurs mainly in the winter months. It has an acute onset of severe symptoms and lasts from 5 to 7 days, less than the duration of symptoms of COVID-19. Symptoms include:
FEVER/CHILLS
COUGH
GENERAL PAYMENT
MYALGIA/ARTHRALGIA
Nasal collapse
PHARYNGAL
LEAKAGE EFFECTS
DYSPHONOA
The best way to prevent the flu is to get vaccinated, especially in the fall when the COVID-19 virus is around. Most people experience complete remission of symptoms within a few days with antipyretics, fluids and rest.
SEASONAL ALLERGY Seasonal allergy is the reaction of the immune system to a foreign substance, accompanied by a series of symptoms that unfortunately can be compared to the symptoms of COVID-19. "Foreign substances" include various allergens such as pollen, dust, animal dander, various foods, etc. Seasonal allergy often includes upper respiratory symptoms, but without the presence of systemic symptoms. Common symptoms are:
Nasal collapse
SNEEZE
ITCHY NOSE AND EYES
EYE IRRITATION
MILD IRRITATION OF THE PHARYNX
FEVER OCCURS VERY RARELY
Seasonal allergy usually lasts a few weeks or months depending on the allergen.
In conclusion, the new coronavirus very often causes fever, dry cough and shortness of breath and affects the lungs more. It usually does not present with a runny nose unlike the other flu, common cold and allergy cases.
The new coronavirus, COVID-19, has shocked humanity worldwide. It is important to quickly recognize the possible symptoms of the virus, so that we can immediately notify our doctor and do the right diagnostic tests. This way we will be able to deal with the virus and protect ourselves and our loved ones from serious complications.
